definition[0]: when something is lost or destroyed, especially in a way that is not useful or reasonable, or the amount that is lost or destroyed
example[0]: The system used to result in a great deal of food wastage.
example[1]: wastage of ability among working class children
definition[1]: an amount of something that is lost or destroyed
example[2]: Penalties should be introduced for excessive wastage of materials.
example[3]: Our courses are designed to maximise the learning process and minimise time and money wastage.
definition[2]: a reduction in the number of people working for a company, organization etc because workers decide to leave or stop working, not because they have lost their jobs
example[4]: We achieved a 40% reduction in staff through natural wastage and redeployment to other offices.
